thinking.disposable_income: Lincoln Park is an affluent area with median household income of $134,277 and 61.3% of households earning over $100,000. This suggests residents have significant disposable income and can absorb moderate increases in transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With high per capita income ($109,538), residents likely have substantial discretionary spending. A sales tax increase would affect this but may be less impactful than in lower-income areas
thinking.accessibility: The area has high transit usage (33.4%) and low car dependency (32.3% no vehicle, 47.8% one vehicle). Good mix of transportation options with significant walk/bike share (9.3%). Many residents work from home (24%)
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized policies that improve transit times given high transit usage. 2. Moderate fare increases acceptable given high income levels. 3. Support for driving fees to reduce congestion and fund transit. 4. Balanced approach to sales tax given high discretionary spending. 5. Considered that many residents use multiple modes of transportation
